node.name: spaceinyourface
node.description: The goal of Space In Your Face (SIYF) is to bring telescope and naked eye astronomy to users of all ages and ability groups. SIYF is a group effort originating during Module 3 at Turing School of Software & Design. This team included Jeremy Bennett, Deonte Cooper, Matt Levy, Corey Sheesley, and Matt Weiss.

node.name: PokeTeamBuilder
node.description: This is a Pokemon Team Builder app. The purpose of this app is to provide and set up a team for competitive battle or even local fun battles without going through the grind a team of unknown potential. (Currently Working on)

node.name: sweater-weather
node.description: This is a weather app using Ruby on Rails. This project is the Mod 3 Final assignment from the Turing School of Software and Design. Assignment details are available in the @turingschool curriculum repository.

node.name: Express-Sweater-Weather
node.description: Sweater Weather written in JavaScript/Express instead of Ruby on Rails. This is a weather app using JavaScript, built on NodeJS with the Express framework. Sequelize is used for an ORM.  This project is a Mod 4 assignment from the Turing School of Software and Design. Assignment details are available in the @turingschool curriculum repository.

node.name: Rales_Engine
node.description: I used Rails and ActiveRecord to build a JSON API, which exposes the SalesEngine data schema. I also learned how to to build Single-Responsibility controllers to provide a well-designed and versioned API, how to use controller tests to drive my design, and used Ruby and ActiveRecord to perform more complicated business intelligence.
